headline: Caterpillar Says Tariffs Might Cost It Up to $1.8 Billion This Year
summary: The construction and mining manufacturer said it now expects the net impact from tariffs to be $1.5 billion to $1.8 billion this year, up from a previous range of $1.3 billion to $1.5 billion.  As a result, Caterpillar expects its full-year adjusted operating profit margin will be near the bottom of its target range.

headline: Caterpillar Says Higher Tariff Costs May Reach $1.8 Billion
summary: The construction and mining manufacturer is now expecting tariffs to have a greater impact on its finances.

raw.headline: Caterpillar Says Higher Tariff Costs May Reach $1.8 Billion
raw.summary: The construction and mining manufacturer is now expecting tariffs to have a greater impact on its finances.

headline: Caterpillar stock slides in premarket after raising 2025 tariff impact estimate
summary: Investing.com -- Caterpillar Inc. (NYSE:CAT) stock fell 3% in premarket trading Friday after the heavy equipment manufacturer raised its estimate for the impact of tariffs on its 2025 financial results.

headline: Trump Leans on National Security to Justify Next Wave of Tariffs
summary: Trump Leans on National Security to Justify Next Wave of Tariffs

raw.headline: Trump Leans on National Security to Justify Next Wave of Tariffs
raw.summary: Trump Leans on National Security to Justify Next Wave of Tariffs

headline: Caterpillar lifts 2025 tariff hit estimate to as much as $1.8 billion
summary: Sweeping tariffs have raised costs across Caterpillar's supply chain, as the company imports key components such as sensors, even as manufacturers race to localize production.  "While the company continues to take initial mitigating actions to reduce this impact, trade and tariff negotiations continue to be fluid," Caterpillar said in a regulatory filing on Thursday.

headline: Commentary: Trump’s trade war is hurting most sectors of the economy
summary: The latest round of earnings reports revealed widespread damage from the Trump tariffs and other attacks on trade.

raw.headline: Commentary: Trump’s trade war is hurting most sectors of the economy
raw.summary: The latest round of earnings reports revealed widespread damage from the Trump tariffs and other attacks on trade.

headline: US second-quarter GDP revised higher; weekly jobless claims fall
summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -The U.S. economy grew faster than initially thought in the second quarter, in part driven by business investment in intellectual property such as artificial intelligence, but tariffs on imports continued to cloud the outlook.  The upgrade to gross domestic product reported by the Commerce Department on Thursday also reflected upward revisions to consumer spending as well as business investment in equipment.  With the Federal Reserve focused on a softening labor market, economists expected the U.S. central bank to resume cutting interest rates next month.

With the Federal Reserve focused on a softening labor market, economists expected the U.S. central bank to resume cutting interest rates next month.

headline: US corporate profits rebound in second quarter; GDP growth revised higher
summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -U.S. corporate profits rebounded in the second quarter, but tariffs on imports are raising costs for businesses, which could limit further gains and hamper economic growth.  President Donald Trump's protectionist trade policy has raised the nation's average import duty to its highest level in a century, inflicting pain on companies ranging from retailers to manufacturers.  Caterpillar this month warned tariffs could cost the economic bellwether up to $1.5 billion this year.
